sanskrit:
श्रीगुरु चरण सरोज रज निज मनु मुकुरु सुधारि।
बरनउँ रघुबर बिमल जसु जो दायकु फल चारि॥

बुद्धिहीन तनु जानिके सुमिरौं पवन-कुमार।
बल बुद्धि बिद्या देहु मोहिं हरहु कलेस बिकार॥

जय हनुमान ज्ञान गुन सागर।
जय कपीस तिहुँ लोक उजागर॥

राम दूत अतुलित बल धामा।
अंजनि पुत्र पवनसुत नामा॥

महाबीर बिक्रम बजरंगी।
कुमति निवार सुमति के संगी॥

कंचन बरन बिराज सुबेसा।
कानन कुंडल कुँचित केसा॥

हाथ बज्र औ ध्वजा बिराजै।
काँधे मूँजा जुनेऊ साजै॥

शंकर सुवन केसरी नंदन।
तेज प्रताप महा जग बंदन॥

विद्यावान गुनी अति चातुर।
राम काज करीबे को आतुर॥

प्रभु चरित्र सुनिबे को रसिया।
राम लखन सीता मन बसिया॥

सूक्ष्म रूप धरी सियहि दिखावा।
विकट रूप धरी लंका जरावा॥

भीम रूप धरी असुर संहारे।
रामचन्द्र के काज संवारे॥

लाय सजीवन लखन जियाए।
श्री रघुबीर हरषि उर लाए॥

रघुकुल नायक रामचन्द्र की जय।
जय जय जय हनुमान गोसाईं॥

कृपा करहु गुरु देव की नाईं।
जो सत बार पाठ कर कोई।
छूटहि बंदि महा सुख होई॥

जो यह पढ़े हनुमान चालीसा।
होय सिद्धि साखी गौरीसा॥

तुलसीदास सदा हरि चेरा।
कीजै नाथ हृदय महँ डेरा॥
transliteration:
Śrīguru caraṇa saroja raja nija manu mukura sudhāri.
Baranau raghubara bimala jasu jo dāyaku phala cāri.

Buddhihīna tanu jānike sumirau pavana-kumāra.
Bala buddhi vidyā dehu mohi haraḥu kalesa vikāra.

Jaya hanumān jñāna guṇa sāgara.
Jaya kapīsa tiḥuṁ loka ujāgara.

Rāma dūta atulita bala dhāmā.
Añjani putra pavanasuta nāmā.

Mahāvīra vikrama bajaraṅgī.
Kumati nivāra sumati ke saṅgī.

Kaṅcana varaṇa virāja subesā.
Kānaṇa kuṇḍala kuñcita keśā.

Hātha vajra au dhvajā virājai.
Kāndhe mūnja janeu sājai.

Śaṅkara suvana kēsarī nandana.
Teja pratāpa mahā jaga bandana.

Vidyāvāna guṇī ati cātura.
Rāma kāja karibe ko ātura.

Prabhu caritra sunibe ko rasiya.
Rāma lakhaṇa sītā mana basiya.

Sūkṣma rūpa dhari siyahi dikhāvā.
Vikaṭ rūpa dhari laṅkā jarāvā.

Bhīma rūpa dhari asura saṅhāre.
Rāmacandra ke kāja saṅvāre.

Lāya sajīvana lakhaṇa jiyāye.
Śrī raghubīra haraṣi ura lāye.

Raghukula nāyaka rāmacandra kī jaya.
Jaya jaya jaya hanumān gosāī.

Kṛpā karahu guru deva kī nāī.
Jo sata bāra pāṭha kar koī.
Chūṭahi bandi mahā sukha hoī.

Jo yaha paṛhe hanumān cālīsā.
Hoya siddhi sākī gaurīsā.

Tulasīdāsa sadā hari cerā.
Kījai nātha hṛdaya mahaṁ ḍerā.
english: With the dust of the Guru’s lotus feet, I cleanse the mirror of my mind and sing the pure glory of Lord Rama, which bestows the four fruits of life: Dharma, Artha, Kama, and Moksha.
I, being ignorant, remember you, O son of the Wind God. Grant me strength, wisdom, and knowledge, and remove my afflictions and impurities.
Victory to Hanuman, ocean of wisdom and virtue, illuminator of the three worlds. You are the messenger of Rama, the abode of incomparable strength, son of Anjana and the Wind God.
Great hero, mighty as a thunderbolt, remover of negative thoughts and companion to the good.
Golden hued and splendidly adorned with heavy earrings and curly locks.
In your hands shine mace and a banner; a sacred thread of munja grass adorns your shoulder.
You are Siva’s incarnation and Kesari’s son – your glory is renowned throughout the world.
You are the supremely wise, virtuous, and clever. You are ever intent on Ram’s work.
You delight in hearing of the Lord’s deeds. Ram, Lakshman, and Sita dwell in your heart.
Assuming a tiny form you appeared to Sita, and in awesome guise you burned Lanka.
Taking a dreadful form, you slaughtered the demons and completed Lord Ram’s mission.
Bringing the life-giving sajivana herb, you revived Lakshman, and Shri Ram joyfully embraced you.
Victory to Lord Ram, the leader of the Raghu dynasty.
Victory, victory, victory to Hanuman, the Lord of monkeys.
Be merciful like the Guru.
One who recites this Hanuman Chalisa a hundred times.
Will be freed from bondage and attain great happiness.
One who reads this Hanuman Chalisa.
Will attain perfection, as testified by Lord Shiva.
Tulsidas is always a servant of Lord Ram.
May Lord Ram reside in my heart.

Vishnu Sahasranama (Full).sanskrit:
शुक्लांबरधरं विष्णुं शशिवर्णं चतुर्भुजम्।
प्रसन्नवदनं ध्यायेत् सर्वविघ्नोपशान्तये॥
ॐ विष्वं विष्णुर्वषट्कारो भूतभव्यभवत्प्रभुः।
भूतकृद्भूतभृद्भावो भूतात्मा भूतभावनः॥
... (continuation of 1,000 names of Vishnu) ...
Vishnu Sahasranama (Full).transliteration:
Śuklāṁbaradharaṁ Viṣṇuṁ Śaśivarṇaṁ Caturbhujam,
Prasanna-Vadanaṁ Dhyāyet Sarva-Vighnopaśāntaye.
Om Viśvaṁ Viṣṇur Vaṣaṭkāro Bhūtabhavyabhavatprabhuḥ,
Bhūtakṛdbhūtabhṛdbhāvo Bhūtātmā Bhūtabhāvanaḥ.
... (continuation of 1,000 names in transliteration) ...
Vishnu Sahasranama (Full).english:
I meditate upon Lord Vishnu, clad in white garments, moon-hued, with four arms, whose face beams with joy, to remove all obstacles.
He is the universe, Vishnu, the one invoked by sacred utterances, the Lord of past, present, and future. The creator, sustainer, and supporter of all beings, the soul of all beings, the cause of all beings.
... (translation of the remaining names) ...

sanskrit:
जटाटवीगलज्जलप्रवाहपावितस्थले
गलेवलम्ब्यलम्बितां भुजङ्गतुङ्गमालिकाम्।
डमड्डमड्डमड्डमन्निनादवड्डमर्वयं
चकार चण्डताण्डवं तनोतु नः शिवः शिवम्॥१॥

जटा कटा हसंभ्रम भ्रमन्निलिंपनिर्झरी
विलोलवीचिवल्लरीविराजमानमूर्धनि।
धगद्धगद्धगज्ज्वलल्ललाटपट्टपावके
किशोरचन्द्रशेखरे रति: प्रतिक्षणं मम॥२॥

धराधरेन्द्रनन्दिनीविलासबन्धुबन्धुर
स्फुरद्दिगन्तसन्तति: प्रमोदमानमन्थसे।
कृपाकटाक्षधोरणीनिरुद्धदुर्धरापदि
क्वचिद्विगम्बरे मनोविनोदमेतु वस्तुनि॥३॥

जटाभुजङ्गपिङ्गलस्फुरत्फणामणिप्रभा
कदम्बकुङ्कुमद्रवप्रलिप्तदिग्वधूमुखे।
मदांधसिन्धुरस्फुरत्वगुत्तरीयमेदुरे
मनोविनोदद्भुतं बिंभर्तुभूतभर्तरि॥४॥

सहस्रलोचनप्रभृत्यशेषलेखशेखर
प्रसूनधूलिधोरणीविधूसरां घ्रिपीठभू:।
भुजङ्गराजमालयानिबद्धजाटजूटक: 
श्रियैचिरायजायतां चकोरबन्धुशेखर:॥५॥

ललाटचत्वरज्वलद्धनञ्जयस्फुलिङ्गभा
निपीतपञ्चसायकेनमन्निलिंपनायकम्।
सुधामयूखलेखया विराजमानशेखरं
महाकपालिसंपदे शिरोजटालमस्तुन:॥६॥

करालभालपट्टिकाधगद्धगद्धगज्ज्वलद्धनञ्जयाधरीकृतप्रचण्डपञ्चसायके।
धराधरेन्द्रनन्दिनीकुचाग्रचित्रपत्रकप्रकल्पनैकशिल्पिनीत्रिलोचनेरतिर्मम॥७॥

नवीनमेघमण्डलीनिरुद्धदुर्धरस्फुरत्कुहुनिशीथनीतम:प्रबद्धबद्धकन्धर:।
निलिम्पनिर्झरीधरस्तनोतु कृत्तिसिंधुर:कलानिधानबन्धुर:श्रियम् जगद्धुरन्धर:॥८॥

प्रफुल्लनिलपङ्कजप्रपञ्जकालीमप्रभा
वलम्बिकान्तकन्दलीरुचिप्रबद्धकन्दहरम्।
स्मरच्छिदं पुरच्छिदं भवच्छिदं मखच्छिदं
नमच्छिदं महच्छिदं तमोच्छिदं प्रणमाम्यहम्॥९॥

नवीनमेघमण्डलीनिरुद्धदुर्धरस्फुरत्कुहुनिशीथनीतम:प्रबद्धबद्धकन्धर:।
निलिम्पनिर्झरीधरस्तनोतु कृत्तिसिंधुर:कलानिधानबन्धुर:श्रियम् जगद्धुरन्धर:॥१०॥

कदा निलिंपनिर्झरीनिकुंजकोटरेवसन्विमुक्तदुर्मतिरशिर:स्थमञ्जलिंवहन।
विमुक्तलोललोचनोललामभाललग्नक:शिवेति मन्त्रमुच्चरन्कदा सुखी भवाम्यहम्॥११॥
इति श्रीदशकण्ठरावण विरचितं श्री शिव ताण्डव स्तोत्रम्।
transliteration:
Jatātavīgalajjala pravāhapāvitasthale
Galevalambyalambitāṁ bhujangatuṅgamālikām.
Ḍamaḍḍamaḍḍamaḍḍamaṇ ninādavaḍḍamarvayaṁ
Cakāra caṇḍa tāṇḍavaṁ tanotu naḥ śivaḥ śivam.

Jaṭākaṭāhasaṁbhraṁ bhramannilimpanirjharī
Vilolavīcivallaryvirājamānamūrdhani.
Dhagaddhagaddhagajjvalallalāṭapaṭṭapāvake
Kiśoracandraśekhare ratiḥ pratikṣaṇaṁ mama.

Dharādharendra nandinīvilāsabandhubandhur
Sphuraddigantasantatiḥ pramodamānamanthase.
Kṛpākṭākṣadhoraṇīniruddhadurhārāpadi
Kvacidvigaṁbare manovinoḍametu vastuni.

Jaṭābhujangapiṅgalasphuratfṇāmaṇiprabha
Kadambakuṅkumadravapraliptadigvadhūmukhe.
Madāndhasindhurasphuratvaguttarīyamedure
Manovinoḍadbhutaṁ bimbhartubhūtabhartari.

Sahasralocanaprabṛtyaśeṣalekhaśekhar
Prasūnadhūlidhoraṇīvidhūsarāṁ ghripīṭabhūḥ.
Bhujangarājamālayānibaddajātajūṭakaḥ
Śriyaicirāyajayataṁ cakorabandhuśekharaḥ.

Lalāṭacatvarajvaladdhanan̄jayasphuliṅgabhā
Nipītapañcasāyakena mannilimpanāyakam.
Sudhāmayūkhalekhaya virājamānaśekharaṁ
Mahākapālisaṁpade śirojaṭālamastunaḥ.

Karālabhālapattikādhagaddhagaddhagajjvaladdhanan̄jayādhārīkṛtapracaṇḍapañcasāyakē.
Dharādharendra nandinīkucāgracitrakaprakalpanaiśilpinītrilocanēratirmama.

Navīnameghamaṇḍalīniruddhadurhārasphuratkūhanishīthanītamaprabaddhaddhakandharaḥ.
Nilimpanirjharīdharaḥ tanotu kṛttisindhuraḥkalānidhānabandhuraḥ śriyaṁ jagaddhurandharaḥ.

Praphullanilapankajaprapañjakālīmaprabhā
Valambikāntakandalīruciprabaddhakandharam.
Smaracchidaṁ puracchidaṁ bhavacchidaṁ makacchidaṁ
Namacchidaṁ mahacchidaṁ tamościdaṁ praṇamāmyaham.

Navīnameghamaṇḍalīniruddhadurhārasphuratkūhanishīthanītamaprabaddhaddhakandharaḥ.
Nilimpanirjharīdharaḥ tanotu kṛttisindhuraḥkalānidhānabandhuraḥ śriyaṁ jagaddhurandharaḥ.

Kadā nilimpanirjharīnikunjakotarevasanvimuṭṭadurmatiraśirastamañjaliṁvahan.
Vimuṭṭalolalocanollālāmabhāladhṛṅkakāśiveti mantramuccharan kadā sukhī bhavāmyaham.
Iti śrīdaśakaṇṭharāvaṇa viracitaṁ śrī śiva tāṇḍava stotraṁ.
english: With his neck consecrated by the flow of water from his matted hair, and the snake coiled around it like a garland, the sound of his Damaru resounding, Lord Shiva performs the fierce Tandava dance. May he bless us with prosperity. (Verse 1)
I have a deep interest in Shiva, whose head is glorified by the waves of the celestial Ganga, whose forehead shines with fire, and whose crescent moon adorns his head. (Verse 2)
May my mind rejoice in the wondrous Shiva, whose body is wrapped with elephant skin, whose snakes glow like gems, and whose presence adds beauty to the world. (Verse 3)
May I seek joy in Shiva, the supporter of all beings, with locks smeared in divine colour, wearing a tiger skin, and dazzling in brilliance. (Verse 4)
May He whose neck is dark as the new moon night, who wears the celestial river on his head, and who killed Gajasura, bless us with wealth and prosperity. (Verse 5)
May He who is the only one capable of creating divine artistry, who possesses three eyes, and whose mind brings joy to all, be revered. (Verse 6)

May my mind seek happiness in Shiva, who has matted hair, a garland of snakes, a crescent moon, carries a trident, destroys evil, is lord of the universe, source of knowledge, and supreme reality. (Verse 7)
May He whose neck is dark as layered clouds, who wears the celestial river, and carries the world’s burden, bless us abundantly. (Verse 8)
May He whose dark neck resembles new clouds, adorned with the celestial river and crescent moon, who killed demons, bless the devotees with all kinds of wealth. (Verse 9)
May He, the eternal, supreme reality, with matted locks, third eye, and radiant presence, protect us and inspire devotion in our hearts. (Verse 10)
Thus concludes the Shiva Tandava Stotram, composed by Ravana, praising the mighty and fierce Tandava dance of Lord Shiva. (Verse 11)

शङ्खचक्रगदाहस्ते महालक्ष्मि नमोऽस्तुते॥
... (remaining 11 verses of Lakshmi Stotram) ...
Lakshmi Stotra (Full).transliteration:
Namastestu Mahāmāye Śrīpīṭhe Surapūjite,
Śaṅkhacakragadāhasthe Mahālakṣmi Namo'stute.
... (remaining 11 verses in transliteration) ...
Lakshmi Stotra (Full).english:
Salutations to the great Goddess Mahamaya, who is seated on the throne of fortune, worshipped by the gods, holding the conch, discus, and mace in her hands. Salutations to Mahalakshmi.
... (translation of remaining verses) ...

Saraswati Vandana (Full).sanskrit:
या कुन्देन्दु तुषार हार धवला या शुभ्रवस्त्रावृता।
या वीणावरदण्डमण्डितकरा या श्वेतपद्मासना॥
या ब्रह्माच्युतशंकरप्रभृतिभिर्देवैः सदा वन्दिता।
सा मां पातु सरस्वती भगवती निःशेषजाड्यापहा॥
Saraswati Vandana (Full).transliteration:
Ya Kundendu Tuṣāra Hāra Dhavalā Ya Śubhra Vastra'vṛtā,
Ya Vīṇāvara Daṇḍa Maṇḍitakarā Ya Śveta Padmāsanā,
Ya Brahmācyuta Śaṅkara Prabhṛtibhir Devaiḥ Sadā Vanditā,
Sā Māṁ Pātu Sarasvatī Bhagavatī Niḥśeṣa Jāḍyāpahā.
Saraswati Vandana (Full).english: Salutations to Goddess Saraswati, radiant like jasmine, the moon, or snow, adorned in white garments, holding the veena, seated on a white lotus. Revered by Brahma, Vishnu, and Shiva, may she protect me by removing ignorance completely.
